responses.rationale: The phrase 'collateral damage' is an explicit, loaded metaphor framing the impact negatively, preventing a default to Neutral.
The quoted phrase 'top of the list in terms of bad guy viruses' is explicit, loaded language from a source, preventing a default to Neutral.
Explicit framing cues like 'unprecedented number' and 'massive mortality' are present, preventing a default to Neutral.
The vivid verb 'surge' describing price impact is an explicit framing cue, preventing a default to Neutral.
Factual description of symptoms ('Screaming very loud, whole-body tremors', 'seizures') without added explicit framing rhetoric.
